setFlags.comment: Flags can be set in options array

sanitizeByCharacter.comment: Test the string specified in $filter using the function defined by $test

comment:
Encoded Constraint
 
  URL-encode string, optionally strip or encode special characters.
 
  Uses PHP Sanitize Filters http://www.php.net/manual/en/filter.filters.sanitize.php and FILTER_SANITIZE_ENCODED
  to URL-encode string and can accept the following flags:
 
   FILTER_FLAG_STRIP_LOW
   FILTER_FLAG_STRIP_HIGH
   FILTER_FLAG_ENCODE_LOW
   FILTER_FLAG_ENCODE_HIGH

class_properties.name: constraint_allowable_options

validate.name: validate
validate.comment:
Validate
     
      Verifies if string is acceptable or should be processed by the sanitize method
        for URL-encode string responding with true or false and messages

sanitize.name: sanitize
sanitize.comment:
Sanitize
     
      Sanitizes string so that it is URL-encode and complies with configured options

format.name: format
format.comment:
Format
     
      Not used with Encoded, simply returns the field value sent in

validate.name: validate
validate.comment:
Validate
     
      Verifies value is false, 0, 'no', or 'off', responding with true or false and messages

sanitize.name: sanitize
sanitize.comment:
Sanitize
     
      Sets the return value to NULL if it is not false, 0, 'no', or 'off'

format.name: format
format.comment:
Format
     
      Method not used for the True constraint - value simply returned

      Tests a value to determine if it is a valid Float value or should be processed by the
        sanitize method responding with true or false and messages

sanitize.comment:
Sanitize
     
      Sanitizes the field value to ensure contains are float data type

comment:
Html Constraint
 
  To review or override white_list, see AbstractHtml Constraint Class

class_properties.name: white_list
class_properties.comment:
White list
     
      Override in the Request using $options['white_list'] entry.

class_properties.name: html_entities
class_properties.comment:
HTML Entities
     
      Override in the Request using $options['html_entities'] entry.

class_properties.name: encoding
class_properties.comment:
Encoding
     
      Override in the Request using $options['encoding'] entry.

class_properties.name: constraint_allowable_options
class_properties.comment: Available Options defined within properties by Constraint

validate.name: validate
validate.comment:
Validate
     
      Verifies that the field value contents do not contain any HTML tags or attributes
      which are not defined in the white_list. If false, use sanitize to clean content.
     
      To review or override white_list, see AbstractHtml Constraint Class

sanitize.name: sanitize
sanitize.comment:
Sanitize
     
      Sanitizes the field value contents so that there are no HTML tags or attributes
      which have not been defined in the white_list. Critical for security.
     
      To review or override white_list, see AbstractHtml Constraint Class

format.name: format
format.comment:
Format
     
      Escapes the field value contents for presentation on the web; critical for security
     
      To review or override white_list, see AbstractHtml Constraint Class

getOption.comment: Get $option $key value, if available, or use $default value

setFlags.comment: Flags can be set in options array

comment:
The Fieldhandler Request Class is the only entry point for application access, acting as a
   proxy for `validate`, `sanitize`, and `format` constraints requests.
code:
The $request object can be used repeatedly for any `validate`, `sanitize`, and `format` requests.
 
  ```php
 
  $request = new \Molajo\Fieldhandler\Request();
 
  ```
  There are three methods:
 
   validate - evaluates data given constraint criteria returning true or false result and error messages
   filter - cleans field value not in compliance with constraint, returning new value and indicator of change
   format - processes field according to constraint requirements, returning new value and indicator of change
 
  Each method  `validate`, `sanitize`, and `format` use these four parameters:
 
   $field_name - a value to be used in error messages as the name of the field
   $field_value - data value to be validated, filtered, or escaped
   $constraint - the name of the constraint to be used by this request
   $options - associative array of key values pairs; requirements defined by constraint class

class_properties.name: field_name
class_properties.comment: Field Name: value to be used in error messages as the name of the field

class_properties.name: field_value
class_properties.comment: Field Value: data value to be validated, filtered, or escaped

class_properties.name: constraint
class_properties.comment: Constraint: the name of the constraint to be used by this request

class_properties.name: options
class_properties.comment: Options: associative array of key values pairs; requirements defined by constraint class

validate.name: validate
validate.comment: Validate Request - validates $field_value for compliance with constraint specifications

sanitize.name: sanitize
sanitize.comment: Sanitize Request - sanitizes $field_value, if necessary, in accordance with constraint specifications

format.name: format
format.comment:
Format Request - formatting or special treatment defined within constraint specifications
     
      $response = $request->format($field_name, $field_value, $constraint, $options);

setOptions.name: setOptions
setOptions.comment: Set Options

get.name: get
get.comment: Get the current value (or default) of the specified key

isAjax.name: isAjax
isAjax.comment: Determine if Request is the result of an Ajax call

isCli.name: isCli
isCli.comment: Determine if Request is the result of an CLI call

setClient.name: setClient
setClient.comment: Get client information using HTTP_USER_AGENT (Warning: such data is not reliable)

class_properties.name: method
class_properties.comment:
Method - GET, HEAD, POST, DELETE, PUT, PATCH
     
      http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec9.html

get.name: get
get.comment:
Get the request object, as defined by URI Syntax RFC 3986
     
      scheme://user:password
get.example.com:8042\/over\/there\/index.php:
\___________/ \_________/ \__/ \__________________/\______________________/ \__/
                  |               |       |          |                      |                |
               userinfo         host     port       path                  query           fragment
              \____________________________/                      \__/ \____/ \__/ \____/
                          |                                         |    |      |     |
                     authority                                      key  value  key   value
     
      - Returns method, content_type, base_url, url, scheme, secure (boolean), user, password,
        userinfo, host, port, authority, path, query, parameters (named pair query array)

setScheme.name: setScheme
setScheme.comment: Set the scheme and secure values

setIsSecure.name: setIsSecure
setIsSecure.comment: Set value indicating if request is a secure protocol

setHost.name: setHost
setHost.comment: Set and Filter Host (potentially set port)

setQueryParameters.name: setQueryParameters
setQueryParameters.comment: Builds query parameters array with sorted key/value pairs

setQueryString.name: setQueryString
setQueryString.comment: Set normalized query string with sorted key/value pairs

class_properties.name: header_status
class_properties.comment: HTTP response codes with associated messages

get.name: get
get.comment:
Get the server object, including the following elements:
     
      - user, password, document_root, entry_point, remote_addr, server_signature, server_software,
       server_name, server_addr, server_port, server_admin

setUser.name: setUser
setUser.comment: Set User running script on the Server for this Class

setPassword.name: setPassword
setPassword.comment: Set Password for User for the class property

setDocumentRoot.name: setDocumentRoot
setDocumentRoot.comment: Set the Document Root for the Server for the class property

setEntryPoint.name: setEntryPoint
setEntryPoint.comment: Set Class Entry Point for the script

setServer.name: setServer
setServer.comment: Set Class Server Variables for the class property

class_properties.name: file_array
class_properties.comment: $file_array contains a copy of the $_FILE super global

class_properties.name: allowable_mimes_and_extensions
class_properties.comment: Allowable File Extensions and Mime Types

class_properties.name: not_used_allowable_mimes_and_extensions
class_properties.comment: Allowable File Extensions and Mime Types

class_properties.name: units_of_measure
class_properties.comment: Conversion from Unit of Measure to Bytes Table

class_properties.name: maximum_file_size
class_properties.comment: Maximum File Size expressed in unit of measure

class_properties.name: maximum_file_size_in_bytes
class_properties.comment: Maximum File Size calculated from previous

validateInputFieldName.name: validateInputFieldName
validateInputFieldName.comment: Validate Upload File is available in the $_FILE super global

createFileArray.name: createFileArray
createFileArray.comment: Create File Array takes the $_POST madness and turns it into something normal

validateUploadFileExists.name: validateUploadFileExists
validateUploadFileExists.comment: Validate Upload File from $_FILE super global exists

has.name: has
has.comment: Determines if the entry identified by the $key exists within the Container

get.name: get
get.comment: Get Contents from Container Entry associated with the key or return false

set.name: set
set.comment: Set the Container Entry with the associated value

class_properties.name: remove_container_entries
class_properties.comment: Container Entries to remove from IoCC

class_properties.name: set_container_entries
class_properties.comment: Services to update within the IoCC

class_properties.name: schedule_factory_methods
class_properties.comment: Services to schedule for Product Creation

getNamespace.name: getNamespace
getNamespace.comment: Factory Method Controller requests Product Namespace from Factory Method

getOptions.name: getOptions
getOptions.comment: Factory Method Controller requests Service Options from Factory Method

getStoreContainerEntryIndicator.name: getStoreContainerEntryIndicator
getStoreContainerEntryIndicator.comment: Factory Method Controller retrieves "store instance indicator" from Factory Method

setDependencies.name: setDependencies
setDependencies.comment:
Factory Method can use this method to define Service Dependencies
       or use the Service Dependencies automatically defined by Reflection processes

onBeforeInstantiation.name: onBeforeInstantiation
onBeforeInstantiation.comment:
Logic contained within this method is invoked after Dependencies Instances are available
       and before the instantiateClass Method is invoked

instantiateClass.name: instantiateClass
instantiateClass.comment: Service instantiated automatically or within this method by the Factory Method

onAfterInstantiation.name: onAfterInstantiation
onAfterInstantiation.comment:
Logic contained within this method is invoked after the class construction
       and can be used for setter logic or other post-construction processing

getProductValue.name: getProductValue
getProductValue.comment: Factory Method Controller requests Product Result for just created Class from Factory Method

removeContainerEntries.name: removeContainerEntries
removeContainerEntries.comment: Request for array of Products to be removed from the IoC Container

setContainerEntries.name: setContainerEntries
setContainerEntries.comment: Request for array of Products and Values to be saved to the IoC Container

scheduleFactories.name: scheduleFactories
scheduleFactories.comment: Request for array of Factory Methods to be Scheduled

comment:
Factory Method Controller
 
  Driven by the Factory Method Controller to interact with Factory Method Adapter
   to resolve dependencies by constructing dependent classes and construct
   the primary class, itself, once all dependencies are available
author: Amy Stephen

class_properties.name: container_key
class_properties.comment:
Container Key
     
      Value is the Factory Method Namespace unless it is Standard Factory Method
      in which case it is the Namespace for the Class, itself

__construct.name: __construct
__construct.comment: The Constructor is invoked by Controller->setProductWorkObject for each request

getNamespace.name: getNamespace
getNamespace.comment: Factory Method Controller requests Product Namespace from Factory Method

getOptions.name: getOptions
getOptions.comment: Factory Method Controller requests Service Options from Factory Method

getStoreContainerEntryIndicator.name: getStoreContainerEntryIndicator
getStoreContainerEntryIndicator.comment: Factory Method Controller retrieves "store instance indicator" from Factory Method

setDependencies.name: setDependencies
setDependencies.comment:
Factory Method Controller provides reflection values which the Factory Method
       can use to set Dependencies. Alternatively, Dependencies can be specifically defined
       by the Factory Method. In either case, Dependencies are returned to the IoC Service
       Provider Controller.

removeDependency.name: removeDependency
removeDependency.comment:
Factory Method Controller removes Dependency (Either itself or for if_exists)
     
      Note: no communication with the Factory Method in this method

setDependencyValue.name: setDependencyValue
setDependencyValue.comment:
Factory Method Controller provides an Instance for Dependency, not sent to the
       Factory Method until all Dependencies in place. At that time, the Factory Method Controller
       uses onBeforeInstantiation to send satisfied Dependencies to the Factory Method
     
      Note: no communication with the Factory Method in this method

getRemainingDependencyCount.name: getRemainingDependencyCount
getRemainingDependencyCount.comment:
Factory Method Controller requests count of Dependencies not yet satisfied
     
      Note: no communication with the Factory Method in this method

onBeforeInstantiation.name: onBeforeInstantiation
onBeforeInstantiation.comment: Factory Method Controller shares Dependency Instances with Factory Method for final processing before Class creation

instantiateClass.name: instantiateClass
instantiateClass.comment: Factory Method Controller triggers the Factory Method to create the Class for the Service

onAfterInstantiation.name: onAfterInstantiation
onAfterInstantiation.comment:
Factory Method Controller triggers the Factory Method to execute logic that follows class instantiation,
       Location for Setter Dependencies or any other actions that must follow Class Creation

getProductValue.name: getProductValue
getProductValue.comment: Factory Method Controller requests Product Result for just created Class from Factory Method

removeContainerEntries.name: removeContainerEntries
removeContainerEntries.comment: Following Class creation, Factory Method requests the Factory Method Controller remove Services from the Container

setContainerEntries.name: setContainerEntries
setContainerEntries.comment: Following Class creation, Factory Method requests the Factory Method Controller instantiate Services

scheduleFactories.name: scheduleFactories
scheduleFactories.comment: Following Class creation, Factory Method requests the Factory Method Controller instantiate Services

class_properties.name: adapter_namespace_prefix
class_properties.comment: IoC Factory Method Namespaces - lookup table

createMap.name: createMap
createMap.comment: Create resource map of folder/file locations and Fully Qualified Namespaces

MapFactories.name: MapFactories
MapFactories.comment: Map IoCC Dependency Injection Handler Namespaces

comment: Schedule for processing Factory Method Requests and Container Entries
author: Amy Stephen

class_properties.name: standard_adapter_namespaces
class_properties.comment: Standard IoC Factory Method (Used when no custom Factory Method is required)

setWorkObject.name: setWorkObject
setWorkObject.comment: Set the Request Work Object used within this class

completeRequest.name: completeRequest
completeRequest.comment: Instantiate Class now that dependencies have been satisfied and finish processing

getFactoryMethod.name: getFactoryMethod
getFactoryMethod.comment: Instantiate DI Adapter, injecting it with the Handler instance

getFactoryMethodAdapter.name: getFactoryMethodAdapter
getFactoryMethodAdapter.comment: Instantiate Factory Method to inject into the Adapter Constructor

loadClassDependencies.name: loadClassDependencies
loadClassDependencies.comment: Load Class Dependencies and Factory Method Aliases

author: Amy Stephen
